jobs.title: Frontend developer
list: Implement Frontend applications for a SaaS platform in React/TS
Build, maintain and extend internal Frontend packages
achievements: Learned how to work with an internal UI library.

jobs.title: Frontend developer
list: Support with feature concepting and design
2nd line tech-support help for the more complicated cases
achievements: As a side project I was redesigning and rebuilding the application with vertical navigation, and after being liked by the users and approved by management, it became a complete feature and is now live in production.
Officially changed job from QA to Frontend developer.

jobs.title: Quality Assurance
list: QA of the Angular applications (Patient and Physio)
QA of the React native application (Patient)
achievements: As the first QA in the company - implemented quality assurance into the development process.
Got to know all products end-to-end, including the backend parts and the database structure, and used that knowledge to actively assist the Support team in their daily work.
Made my 'first steps' towards becoming a developer by picking and fixing bugs in a React Native application during the QA work downtime.

jobs.title: Quality Assurance
list: Quality Control for hardware products - lasers' power supplies, slot machines, door and window sensors
Writing Quality Control manuals for various hardware products
achievements: Changed career path from an engineer working in Physics to an engineer working in IT.

profile: A QA-turned Frontend developer with good analytical and communication skills, and a keen eye for UX improvements. A team-player with an ability to work under strict deadlines. Eager to learn about new technologies.
name: Simeon Simeonov

education.title: BSc in Applied Physics
education.extra: After graduating high-school with profiles Math and Physics, the choice was becoming either an engineer in Applied Physics or in IT - I deemed the latter boring. Today's me slightly disagrees.

interests.extra: A small pride is that I built my desktop pc, picking carefully every part to a build not only a powerful machine, but also an aesthetically pleasing one.

languages.extra: A long paragraph of extra blah blah, but a funny one!
